speaker: BIONDELLO
text: Softly and swiftly, sir, for the priest is

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: ready.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text: I fly, Biondello. But they may chance to

speaker: LUCENTIO
text: need thee at home. Therefore leave us.

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: Nay, faith, I’ll see the church a’ your back,

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: and then come back to my master’s as soon as I

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: can.

speaker: GREMIO
text: I marvel Cambio comes not all this while.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Sir
              ,
               
              here’s
               
              the
               
              door
              .
               
              This
               
              is
               
              Lucentio’s
               
              house
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
My
               
              father’s
               
              bears
               
              more
               
              toward
               
              the
               
              marketplace
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Thither
               
              must
               
              I
              ,
               
              and
               
              here
               
              I
               
              leave
               
              you
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
You
               
              shall
               
              not
               
              choose
               
              but
               
              drink
               
              before
               
              you
               
              go
              .

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
I
               
              think
               
              I
               
              shall
               
              command
               
              your
               
              welcome
               
              here
              ,

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
And
               
              by
               
              all
               
              likelihood
               
              some
               
              cheer
               
              is
               
              toward
              .

speaker: GREMIO
text:
They’re
               
              busy
               
              within
              .
               
              You
               
              were
               
              best
               
              knock
               
              louder
              .

speaker: MERCHANT
text: What’s he that knocks as

speaker: MERCHANT
text: he would beat down the gate?

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Is Signior Lucentio within, sir?

speaker: MERCHANT
text: He’s within, sir, but not to

speaker: MERCHANT
text: be spoken withal.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: What if a man bring him a hundred pound

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: or two to make merry withal?

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Keep your hundred

speaker: MERCHANT
text: pounds to yourself. He shall need none so long as I

speaker: MERCHANT
text: live.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Nay, I told you your son was

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: well beloved in Padua.—Do you hear, sir? To leave

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: frivolous circumstances, I pray you tell Signior

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Lucentio that his father is come from Pisa and is

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: here at the door to speak with him.

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Thou liest. His father is

speaker: MERCHANT
text: come from Padua and here looking out at the

speaker: MERCHANT
text: window.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Art thou his father?

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Ay, sir, so his mother says,

speaker: MERCHANT
text: if I may believe her.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Why, how now, gentleman!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Why, this is flat knavery, to take upon you another

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: man’s name.

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Lay hands on the villain. I

speaker: MERCHANT
text: believe he means to cosen somebody in this city

speaker: MERCHANT
text: under my countenance.

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: I have seen them in the church

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: together. God send ’em good shipping! But who is

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: here? Mine old master Vincentio! Now we are

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: undone and brought to nothing.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Come hither, crack-hemp.

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: I hope I may choose, sir.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Come hither, you rogue! What, have you

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: forgot me?

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: Forgot you? No, sir. I could not forget you,

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: for I never saw you before in all my life.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: What, you notorious villain, didst thou

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: never see thy master’s father, Vincentio?

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: What, my old worshipful old master? Yes,

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: marry, sir. See where he looks out of the window.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Is ’t so indeed?

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: Help, help, help! Here’s a madman will

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: murder me.

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Help, son! Help, Signior

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Baptista!

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: Prithee, Kate, let’s stand aside and see the

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: end of this controversy.

speaker: TRANIO
text: Sir, what are you that offer to

speaker: TRANIO
text: beat my servant?

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: What am I, sir? Nay, what are you, sir! O

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: immortal gods! O fine villain! A silken doublet, a

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: velvet hose, a scarlet cloak, and a copatain hat! O, I

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: am undone, I am undone! While I play the good

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: husband at home, my son and my servant spend all

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: at the university.

speaker: TRANIO
text: How now, what’s the matter?

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: What, is the man lunatic?

speaker: TRANIO
text: Sir, you seem a sober ancient

speaker: TRANIO
text: gentleman by your habit, but your words show you

speaker: TRANIO
text: a madman. Why, sir, what ’cerns it you if I wear

speaker: TRANIO
text: pearl and gold? I thank my good father, I am able

speaker: TRANIO
text: to maintain it.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Thy father! O villain, he is a sailmaker in

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Bergamo.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir! Pray, what

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: do you think is his name?

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: His name? As if I knew not his name! I have

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: brought him up ever since he was three years old,

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: and his name is Tranio.

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Away, away, mad ass! His

speaker: MERCHANT
text: name is Lucentio and he is mine only son, and heir

speaker: MERCHANT
text: to the lands of me, Signior Vincentio.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Lucentio? O, he hath murdered his master!

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Lay hold on him, I charge you in the Duke’s name.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: O, my son, my son! Tell me, thou villain, where is

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: my son Lucentio?

speaker: TRANIO
text: Call forth an officer.

speaker: TRANIO
text: Carry this mad knave to the jail.—Father Baptista, I

speaker: TRANIO
text: charge you see that he be forthcoming.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Carry me to the jail?

speaker: GREMIO
text: Stay, officer. He shall not go to prison.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: Talk not, Signior Gremio. I say he shall go to

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: prison.

speaker: GREMIO
text: Take heed, Signior Baptista, lest you be cony-catched

speaker: GREMIO
text: in this business. I dare swear this is the

speaker: GREMIO
text: right Vincentio.

speaker: MERCHANT
text: Swear, if thou dar’st.

speaker: GREMIO
text: Nay, I dare not swear it.

speaker: TRANIO
text: Then thou wert best say that I

speaker: TRANIO
text: am not Lucentio.

speaker: GREMIO
text: Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: Away with the dotard, to the jail with him.

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Thus strangers may be haled and abused.—

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: O monstrous villain!

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: O, we are spoiled, and yonder he is! Deny

speaker: BIONDELLO
text: him, forswear him, or else we are all undone.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Pardon
              ,
               
              sweet
               
              father
              .

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
Lives
               
              my
               
              sweet
               
              son
              ?

speaker: BIANCA
text:
Pardon
              ,
               
              dear
               
              father
              .

speaker: BAPTISTA
text:
How
               
              hast
               
              thou
               
              offended
              ?

speaker: BAPTISTA
text:
Where
               
              is
               
              Lucentio
              ?

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Here’s
               
              Lucentio
              ,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Right
               
              son
               
              to
               
              the
               
              right
               
              Vincentio
              ,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
That
               
              have
               
              by
               
              marriage
               
              made
               
              thy
               
              daughter
               
              mine

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
While
               
              counterfeit
               
              supposes
               
              bleared
               
              thine
               
              eyne
              .

speaker: GREMIO
text:
Here’s
               
              packing
              ,
               
              with
               
              a
               
              witness
              ,
               
              to
               
              deceive
               
              us
               
              all
              !

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
Where
               
              is
               
              that
               
              damnèd
               
              villain
              ,
               
              Tranio
              ,

speaker: VINCENTIO
text:
That
               
              faced
               
              and
               
              braved
               
              me
               
              in
               
              this
               
              matter
               
              so
              ?

speaker: BAPTISTA
text:
Why
              ,
               
              tell
               
              me
              ,
               
              is
               
              not
               
              this
               
              my
               
              Cambio
              ?

speaker: BIANCA
text:
Cambio
               
              is
               
              changed
               
              into
               
              Lucentio
              .

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Love
               
              wrought
               
              these
               
              miracles
              .
               
              Bianca’s
               
              love

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Made
               
              me
               
              exchange
               
              my
               
              state
               
              with
               
              Tranio
              ,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
While
               
              he
               
              did
               
              bear
               
              my
               
              countenance
               
              in
               
              the
               
              town
              ,

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
And
               
              happily
               
              I
               
              have
               
              arrivèd
               
              at
               
              the
               
              last

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Unto
               
              the
               
              wishèd
               
              haven
               
              of
               
              my
               
              bliss
              .

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
What
               
              Tranio
               
              did
              ,
               
              myself
               
              enforced
               
              him
               
              to
              .

speaker: LUCENTIO
text:
Then
               
              pardon
               
              him
              ,
               
              sweet
               
              father
              ,
               
              for
               
              my
               
              sake
              .

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: I’ll slit the villain’s nose that would have

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: sent me to the jail!

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: But do you hear, sir, have you married my

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: daughter without asking my goodwill?

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: Fear not, Baptista, we will content you. Go

speaker: VINCENTIO
text: to! But I will in to be revenged for this villainy.

speaker: BAPTISTA
text: And I to sound the depth of this knavery.

speaker: LUCENTIO
text: Look not pale, Bianca. Thy father will not

speaker: LUCENTIO
text: frown.

speaker: GREMIO
text:
My
               
              cake
               
              is
               
              dough
              ,
               
              but
               
              I’ll
               
              in
               
              among
               
              the
               
              rest
              ,

speaker: GREMIO
text:
Out
               
              of
               
              hope
               
              of
               
              all
               
              but
               
              my
               
              share
               
              of
               
              the
               
              feast
              .

speaker: KATHERINE
text: Husband, let’s follow to see the end of

speaker: KATHERINE
text: this ado.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: First kiss me, Kate, and we will.

speaker: KATHERINE
text: What, in the midst of the street?

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text: What, art thou ashamed of me?

speaker: KATHERINE
text: No, sir, God forbid, but ashamed to kiss.

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Why
              ,
               
              then
              ,
               
              let’s
               
              home
               
              again
              .
              
                 
                To
                 
                Grumio
                .
              
               
              Come
              ,
               
              sirrah
              ,
               
              let’s
               
              away
              .

speaker: KATHERINE
text:
Nay
              ,
               
              I
               
              will
               
              give
               
              thee
               
              a
               
              kiss
              .

speaker: KATHERINE
text:
Now
               
              pray
               
              thee
              ,
               
              love
              ,

              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO
text:
Is
               
              not
               
              this
               
              well
              ?
               
              Come
              ,
               
              my
               
              sweet
               
              Kate
              .

speaker: PETRUCHIO

Better

              ,
